project.description: This job uploads a specified docker image for core from the local repository to a specified docker registry

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: ECR_REGISTRY_URL
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: Indicates the location of the elastic container registry (ECR) where the docker image is to be pushed to.

secureScript.script: def reg = '730096353738.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com' return "<input type='text' name='value' value='" + reg + "' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace'>"

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: REGISTRY_REPO_NAME
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: This is used to identify the name of the docker registry repository that this image is going to be pushed to. The value is "core" by default, but remember that any feature images should go to a registry repository called "core-feature". Unlike coeus, the docker image for the sandbox environment is no different from any other environment - it is run-time configuration that implement environment specific distinctions.

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.ChoiceParameter.name: VERSION_OPT
org.biouno.unochoice.ChoiceParameter.description: How do you want to enter the version value?

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: VERSION
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: This value reflects the git tag applied to the codebase the docker image was based on. The git commit may not be the exact commit that was tagged, but would be the most recent commit since that tag before the next tag is encountered. Combined with ECR_REGISTRY_URL, this value serves to identify the docker image as it will have been already tagged accordingly.

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace' disabled=true>"

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
[ "$VERBOSE" == false ] && set +x
# Validate the job parameters [ -z "$REGISTRY_REPO_NAME" ] && echo "ERROR! REGISTRY_REPO_NAME cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$ECR_REGISTRY_URL" ] && echo "ERROR! ECR_REGISTRY_URL cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$VERSION" ] && echo "ERROR! VERSION cannot be empty!" && exit 1
# Fix the trailing comma issue with active choices parameters reactive ECR_REGISTRY_URL="$(echo $ECR_REGISTRY_URL | sed 's/,//g')" REGISTRY_REPO_NAME="$(echo $REGISTRY_REPO_NAME | sed 's/,//g')" VERSION="$(echo $VERSION | sed 's/,//g')"
DOCKER_TAG="${ECR_REGISTRY_URL}/${REGISTRY_REPO_NAME}:${VERSION}"
# Login to the registry # NOTE: info on how to store credentials can be found at: # http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/topic/config-vars.html # requires ~/.aws/config
evalstr="$(aws ecr get-login)" # NOTE: The ecr get-login command of the aws cli returns a docker command that includes a removed switch. # The -e (email) switch will be rejected by the newer version of docker that we have installed on our aws # ec2 instances to accomodate cloud watch logging from our containers. Therefore I am removing the offending # "-e none" portion of the command with the stream editor. evalstr="$(echo $evalstr | sed 's/ -e none//')" eval $evalstr
# Push the newly created image to the registry docker push ${DOCKER_TAG}
set -x
